job.name: Automated_Catalog_Objects_Staging

variable.name: SOURCE_ENVIRONMENT
variable.description: The URL of the source ProActive server

variable.name: SOURCE_USER
variable.description: User login needed to access ProActive source environment

variable.name: SOURCE_PASSWORD
variable.description: User password needed to access ProActive source environment. This password must be added to the third-party credentials vault (the user login is the key and the password is the credential).

variable.name: TARGET_ENVIRONMENT
variable.description: The URL of the target ProActive server

variable.name: TARGET_USER
variable.description: User password needed to access ProActive target environment

variable.name: TARGET_PASSWORD
variable.description: User password needed to access ProActive target environment. This password must be added to the third-party credentials vault (the user login is the key and the password is the credential).

variable.name: COMMIT_MESSAGE
variable.description: When promoting an object in the Catalog, users can add a specific commit message. We recommend to always specify commit messages at any commit for an easier differentiation between stored versions.

variable.name: PROMOTION_TAG
variable.description: The tag of catalog objects that allows to determine those objects to be staged from the source to the target ProActive environment.

variable.name: PROMOTION_TAG_REMOVAL
variable.description: If true, the provided promotion tag will be removed from the catalog objects in both source and target environments

variable.name: CALLED_SINGLE_CATALOG_OBJECT_STAGING_PATH
variable.description: single Workflow Staging to submit from the ProActive Catalog

job.description: A workflow that automates the staging of catalog objects from a source to a target ProActive environment. The goal of this workflow is to: (i) browse the catalog of objects in the source environment, (ii) detect all objects having a specific tag (called promotion tag) and (iii) create a copy of these objects in the catalog of the target environment. The workflow provides the possibility to remove the promotion tag from the catalog objects in both source and target environments. This workflow calls a basic workflow to handle the copy of each tagged object in the source catalog.

task.name: Authenticate_Source_Environment
task.description: A task performing a rest POST request to authenticate to the source environment and and acquire a sessionid.

task.name: Get_Source_Bucket_List
task.description: A task that executes a REST GET request to get the list of the buckets in the source environment.

variable.name: ENDPOINT
variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.

variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK
variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification

variable.name: DEBUG
variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.

variable.name: PROXY_HOST
variable.description: The hostname of the proxy

variable.name: PROXY_PORT
variable.description: The port of the proxy

variable.name: PROXY_SCHEME
variable.description: The scheme of the proxy

variable.name: PATH
variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)

variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT
variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)

variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH
variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation

variable.name: HEADERS
variable.description: Additional headers of the request, provided as a JSON key/value structure. Headers can also be specified by adding HEADER_headername variables.

script.code: List bucketList = variables.get("BUCKET_LIST") as ArrayList<String> runs = bucketList.size()

task.name: Filter_Tagged_Catalog_Objects_Per_Bucket
task.description: A task that executes a GET REST request to filter catalog objects of a bucket with respect to a given tag.

variable.name: ENDPOINT
variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.

variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK
variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification

variable.name: DEBUG
variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.

variable.name: PROXY_HOST
variable.description: The hostname of the proxy

variable.name: PROXY_PORT
variable.description: The port of the proxy

variable.name: PROXY_SCHEME
variable.description: The scheme of the proxy

variable.name: PATH
variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)

variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT
variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)

variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH
variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation

variable.name: HEADERS
variable.description: Additional headers of the request, provided as a JSON key/value structure. Headers can also be specified by adding HEADER_headername variables.

script.code: List bucketList = variables.get("BUCKET_LIST") as ArrayList<String> variables.put("PATH", "/catalog/buckets/" + bucketList.get(variables.get("PA_TASK_REPLICATION")) + "/resources")

task.name: Merge_Tagged_Catalog_Objects
task.description: Merge the filtered catalog objects in a single list

task.name: Submit_Single_Catalog_Object_Staging_Job_And_Wait
task.description: Submit the Single_Catalog_object_Staging workflow and wait for its termination by checking every minute if the job is completed.

variable.name: CALLED_SINGLE_CATALOG_OBJECT_STAGING_PATH
variable.description: Workflow to submit from the ProActive Catalog

task.name: Staging_Summary
task.description: Produce a textual summary of the automated staging process to be displayed in the output
